solution_line_template: Mowing lawns will earn Julie {pay_per_lawn}*{lawns_mowed} = <<{pay_per_lawn}*{lawns_mowed}={earnings_from_lawns}>>{earnings_from_lawns} dollars

Her earnings, in dollars, from delivering newspapers will be {newspapers_delivered} *{cents_per_newspaper}/{cents_per_dollar} = <<{newspapers_delivered}*{cents_per_newspaper}/{cents_per_dollar}={earnings_from_newspapers}>>{earnings_from_newspapers} dollars
After walking {dogs_walked} of her neighbor's dogs, she will earn {dogs_walked}* {pay_per_dog} = <<{dogs_walked}*{pay_per_dog}={earnings_from_dogs}>>{earnings_from_dogs} dollars.

She will therefore earn a total of {earnings_from_lawns} + {earnings_from_newspapers} + {earnings_from_dogs} = <<{earnings_from_lawns}+{earnings_from_newspapers}+{earnings_from_dogs}={total_new_earnings}>>{total_new_earnings} dollars

Combining earnings from her job with her savings will give Julie {total_new_earnings} + {initial_savings} = <<{total_new_earnings}+{initial_savings}={total_money_available}>>{total_money_available} dollars

Subtracting the cost of the mountain bike from the total will leave Julie with a balance of {total_money_available} - {bike_cost} = <<{total_money_available}-{bike_cost}={money_left}>>{money_left} dollars
